IBX Field Engineer II

Company Name Equinix Company Location Derrimut, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

IBX Field Engineer II
Are you passionate about technology? Want to kick start your career within a leading global organisation? Our hands on role as a Data Centre Technician might be the role for you.

Who are we?

Equinix is the one of the largest growing Data Centre companies, growing connectivity between clients worldwide. That’s why we're always looking for creative and visionary people who can help us achieve our goal – global interconnection. With over 200 datacentres in over 24 countries spanning across 5 continents, we are home of the Cloud, supporting over 1000 Cloud and IT services companies that are directly engaged in technological innovation and development. We are passionate about further evolving the specific areas of software development, software and network architecture, network operations, and complex cloud and application solutions

The Role

As a Datacentre Technician, you will be part of a team that is at the core of our Equinix Operations department, providing 7/24/365 support to the Datacentre and conducting circuit maintenance, installations and advanced testing. You will also be responsible for the daily upkeep and operations.

Responsibilities

Installations
  • Installs ladder racks and fiber raceways
  • Builds/Installs cages
  • Installs cable management/support systems to include vertical wire managers, horizontal wire managers, and patch panels
  • Performs intra-cage and infrastructure installations
  • Installs and grounds cabinets and two-post racks
Queue Management
  • Escalates SRs that require additional information
  • Testing/Troubleshooting
  • Conducts carrier circuit testing
  • Cross Connects
  • Installs/Tests/Modifies cross connects per SOPs and ensures proper cable management of: coax, fiber, twisted pair copper, and intra-building cross connects
Documentation/Reporting
  • Maintains accurate notes and records of activity fulfillment in ticketing system
  • Projects
  • Supports fulfillment of projects with direction from senior staff
Training
  • Completes all assigned training in a timely manner
  • Customer Management
  • Supports customer satisfaction through timely and precise orders

Requirements/Qualifications
  • 1+ years working experience
  • Willingness to work a 24/7 shift rota that includes day and night shifts
  • A keen interest in data centres, IT, or engineering etc.
  • Strong Customer Service Skills
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a team is essential

Are you interested? Click apply now!

You can also check out our YouTube page to find out more about us: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC9xshmMk-FKjqKCLOKklQQw

Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disabilities

Industry

  • Computer & Network Security
  • Information Technology and Services
  • Internet

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Engineering
  • Information Technology

838934938:
[

Online Partnerships Manager

Company Name Envato Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 271 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, we're a completely online company with an ecosystem of sites and services to help people get creative. In September 2014, one of our sites, ThemeForest, was the 90th most visited website in the world and it remains among the most visited Australian-owned website on the planet! With more than 350 staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $500 Million.

JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and Diversity (2015 and 2016). We were also named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the 2015, 2016 and 2017BRW Awards.


On Envato Market thousands of people earn a living selling things like WordPress themes, photos, music tracks and illustrations. With Envato Elements, we oversee one of the world’s largest subscription services for digital creatives, providing hundreds of thousands of files for unlimited download for one flat fee. We offer website design and hosting with Envato Sites. On our education platform Tuts+, over 5 million people learn skills including code, illustration, photography, web design, and more, each month. We also run a freelance marketplace called Envato Studio.


You might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world, we’re also growing really fast!

\xa0

What you’ll be doing

In this exciting new role as Partnerships Manager at Envato, you’ll be leading, directing and coaching the partnerships team to successfully accomplish goals, looking after things like affiliate marketing, media buying, business development and continued growth within ROI targets. Reporting to the Director of Paid Growth, you’ll ensure the strategic direction you provide your team aligns with the overall group strategy.

We’re after a true people leader who is analytically minded and has a proven track record of driving strategy for profitable growth. Your role is to lead by example, mentor and support to ensure everyone on the team has what they need to be successful.

You’ll be looking at our existing affiliates program to diagnose strengths, weaknesses and opportunities for growth and reporting this and key metrics to your stakeholders. And tasked with creating and maintaining strong relationships with external partners.

\xa0

What we’re looking for

  • Must have experience in working with affiliates, media buying or other online acquisition environments
  • Management experience, ideally of an affiliate or partnerships team
  • Strong analytical skills - able to extract action items from large sets of data
  • Demonstrated business development experience
  • Digital / e-commerce experience desired, ideally in fast growing digital companies
  • Shared values with Envato’s caring and passionate culture

What we offer

  • A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success
  • Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato
  • We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination
  • A fast paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and Envato community members from all over the world!
  • Read more from our staff about why they love working at Envato by visiting www.jobadvisor.com.au/envato
  • Salary of $140k including superannuation (flexible based on experience)


Who should apply?

We care deeply about diversity and inclusion at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you.

What next?

Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to the below questions. Good luck!

Facility and Event Support Officer - Casual

Company Name Nillumbik Shire Council Company Location Nillumbik, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 73 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are seeking highly motivated Facilities and Event Support Officer/s to join our casual pool to be an integral part of the Community Facilities team, Place Activation Unit. The position will be part of a rostered system based on business needs and subject to the availability of the successful candidate/s. This position involves weekend and after hours rostering.

Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Providing event support including bump in, bump out, set ups, breakdown and cleaning at Eltham Community and Reception Centre and any other venue under the direction of the Community Facilities Team Leader.
  • Providing technical support at Eltham Community and Reception Centre, Hurstbridge Community Hub and any other facility as required.
  • Working as part of the Community Facilities team supporting the team on the delivery of functions and events, including offering excellent service to customers.
  • Ensuring the security of the Eltham Community & Reception Centre, other facilities and any adjoining property is maintained during an event / function and during opening and lockups.


To Be Successful In This Role You Will
  • Have qualifications in event support and/ or previous experience in hall keeping and cleaning or a willingness to be trained
  • Be prepared to work flexible hours during the working week which includes evenings and fill some weekend shifts
  • Be able to move heavy articles and furniture, accept deliveries and manage stock
  • Be customer focused
  • Be able to carry out cleaning duties requiring bending and lifting

This is a casual Band 3 position.

Questions regarding this position should be directed to Heather Stewart, Team Leader Community Facilities on (03) 9433 3734.

To be part of this exciting opportunity, you must clearly address the Key Selection Criteria (as set out in the position description).

Applicants will receive an email confirming receipt of their application at the time it is submitted. If you have not received confirmation within 12 hours, contact Organisational Development on (03) 9433 3253.

Philanthropy & Bequests Manager – Sydney or Melbourne

Company Name NGO Recruitment Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 37 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Accelerate life-changing breakthroughs to cure, prevent & treat Type 1 Diabetes
  • Drive a significant increase in funding from philanthropy and major gifts
  • Senior hands on leadership role, interstate travel

\xa0

The Organisation

JDRF Australia is part of a global movement with representation in over 20 countries and has a clear and simple mission, to rid the world of Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) and to make each day better than the one before for people living with T1D.

\xa0

JDRF has a bold fundraising growth plan in place. You will be instrumental in growing their income from fundraising efforts by 2021.

\xa0

JDRF’s five values are passion, integrity, vision, impact and collaboration. JDRF reflect these values in a positive work environment that benefits the organisation as well as employees.

\xa0


Benefits & Culture


• Passionate and collaborative team culture
• Commitment to training and development
• Diverse recognition framework
• Generous salary packaging provisions
• Additional end of year leave

\xa0


The Role

With accountability for the delivery of targeted significant growth funding, you will manage your own portfolio and lead the philanthropy team, with responsibility for managing existing relationships and identifying new prospects. Specifically you will:

\xa0

• Manage your own portfolio and solicit gifts from major donors, trusts and foundations
• Ensure your team deliver on individual targets and metrics
• Work collaboratively with global counterparts and local leadership
• Prepare and submit high quality funding proposals
• Develop effective soliciting and stewarding programs which map to the donor journey
• Be accountable for the delivery of prospect opportunities including researching, wealth screening, donor profile development and actions

\xa0


Skills Required


This role is suited to a seasoned relationship fundraiser with the ability to think laterally and identify opportunities. You will have significant success in growing an organisation’s philanthropic profile and revenue with experience using communications and brand to maximise exposure.

Ideally you are in a similar role in either a NFP, the arts or agency, however, people with relevant commercial sales experience will also be considered. Additionally you will:

\xa0

• Be adept at identifying opportunities, plus developing and maintaining philanthropic relationships
• Have proven ability to articulate vision, mission and progress through effective storytelling
• Exhibit strong people management skills with proven ability to increase performance outcomes
• Demonstrate strong financial acumen

\xa0

Compliance checking will include Police Clearance and Working with Children (WWCC).

\xa0


If you are passionate about improving the lives of people living with T1D and in playing a lead role in creating a world without T1D, please click apply submitting your resume and cover letter addressing the skills required in MS Word format quoting #34501. Or call Lisa Morell or Richard Green on 02 8243 0570.

839536395:
[

Bid Coordinator

Company Name SHAPE Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 134 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A SHAPE Bid Coordinator is the collector and creator. They are the central point of contact, working with all parts of the business to pool together resources and create kick ass submissions. As part of your responsibilities you will;


  • Compile all documentation, proof and prepare tender submissions for approval.
  • Format, print and bind submissions to a high design standard.
  • Establish and manage Bid Action Plans for delivery of submission requirements.
  • Maintain and update Bid & Strategy documentation/information database.
  • Support the Estimating team with coordination, document control, and sub-contractor collaboration.
  • Draft and edit executive summaries as required.
  • Compile client Request for Tender documentation.
  • Provide client research and background analysis to the bid lead.
  • Provide effective communication & collaboration with internal stakeholders of each tender.
  • Ensure subcontractor and supplier awareness in relation to SHAPE bid philosophies and strategies.
  • Identify improvement strategies throughout the bid process.
  • Create dynamic opportunities and maximise the customer experience.


This is a 12 month fixed term contract.

About you
To become a SHAPIAN there are a few skills you’ll need in your toolkit; \xa0
  • Experience in a Graphic Design, Communications or Tender Submissions coordinator role.
  • Design skills with a flair for creativity and imagination.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with all stakeholders.
  • Experience in communication design, styling, and branding awareness.
  • Ability to work to deadlines, well organised and a keen eye for detail.
  • Ability to build and maintain relationships.
  • Independent, innovative and lateral thinking skills.
  • Flexibility, adaptability and being able to proactively problem solve.
  • Proficient in full Adobe suite, including InDesign, MS Office products, and social media platforms.


Life at SHAPE
When we ask our people what makes SHAPE better, they always say ‘the people’ (and the snacks). Our people work hard together, but also celebrate together, laugh together, learn together, dance together and support each other. We’re a pretty close, relaxed bunch. Some of the things you may not know about SHAPE are;
  • We develop our people with technical skills but also leadership skills.
  • Our leaders are measured by the culture they create.
  • We take FUN very seriously.
  • Everyone gets one day off a month as work-life balance leave.
  • We took all of our people on a conference to the hunter valley last year.
Basically, if you can’t have a laugh at yourself then this is probably not the job for you.
\xa0
Find out more
Check out our website for more information and if you think you have what it takes to join our team, apply now.

Note to agencies: We have preferred recruitment partners in place and therefore do not welcome speculative enquiries.

Job description

Looking for a role that offers a wide range of financial responsibilities and management accounting elements to sink your teeth into? We think this role is one not to be missed.

Based in our South Melbourne office we are looking for an experienced accountant to join us and provide a wide range of business partnering, commercial advisory, management accounting, financial accounting, processing, and reporting services to our growing business, more specifically:


  • Monthly account preparation and reporting
  • Annual financial statement preparation and audit activities
  • Business partnering with operational teams
  • Advising on project pricing and financial management, and providing broader commercial advice to the business
  • Tax compliance / preparation of tax return information (GST, FBT, Income Tax etc…)
  • Involvement in process improvement, training delivery, and various project work
  • Regular accounting functions including cashflow and treasury oversight


This role will allow you to use your broad range of financial knowledge and experience and presents a fantastic opportunity to become a trusted advisor and part of the senior leadership team.


Ideally you will have experience delivering similar activities in a chartered accounting firm or a comparable professional services environment, engineering consultancy, or the construction industry and be able to demonstrate:


  • Excellent ability to build rapport with a diverse range of stakeholders
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Tertiary qualified with an accounting degree
  • CA qualified with 5-8 years' experience
  • Excellent communication skills (both written & verbal)
  • Business advisory and partnering experience essential
  • Deltek Vision software experience will be advantageous


Just some of the employee benefits we offer:

  • Professional development opportunities with in-house and external training courses
  • Free onsite gym access
  • Annual wellbeing allowance
  • Work life balance and social club activities
